title: Further Amendments to Executive Order 11478, Equal Employment Opportunity in the Federal Government, and Executive Order 11246, Equal Employment Opportunity

enrichment.summary: This executive order updates previous orders to explicitly prohibit discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity in federal government employment and contracting. It requires the Department of Labor to issue regulations to enforce these protections, promoting equal opportunity and nondiscrimination within federal hiring and procurement.
potential_concerns: Ensuring that anti-discrimination protections based on sexual orientation and gender identity are effectively enforced within federal contractors may be challenging, potentially leading to uneven compliance affecting LGBTQ+ individuals seeking federal contracts.
Federal employees who identify as transgender or LGBTQ+ may face workplace resistance or bias despite formal protections, risking continued discrimination or harassment in practice.

The requirement for the Department of Labor to issue regulations within a short timeframe could result in insufficient stakeholder engagement, leading to overly broad or unclear rules impacting federal contractors and employees.

Some federal contractors might perceive the expanded nondiscrimination requirements as an administrative or compliance burden, potentially discouraging smaller contractors from seeking federal contracts.
